hints_html:
Use the quotient rule.

The quotient rule is

\[\begin{aligned} \left(\frac{g}{h}\right)' = \frac{g'h-h'g}{h^2}\end{aligned}\]
hints_raw:
Use the quotient rule.
The quotient rule is
:<math>
\left(\frac{g}{h}\right)' = \frac{g'h-h'g}{h^2}
</math>
question: 1 (f)
sols_html:
Using the quotient rule we compute

\[\begin{aligned} \left(\frac{x}{x^2-1}\right)' &= \frac{(1)(x^2-1)-(2x)(x)}{(x^2-1)^2} \\ &= \frac{x^2-1-2x^2}{(x^2-1)^2} \\ &= -\frac{x^2+1}{(x^2-1)^2}\end{aligned}\]
statement_html:

Unless otherwise stated, it is not necessary to simplify your answers in this question.

Find the derivative of

\[\begin{aligned} f(x)=\frac{x}{x^2-1}\end{aligned}\]

Please simplify your answer.
